medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A, a 68-year-old woman, has a history of recurrent unipolar depressions since her teens. She was hospitalized 13 times over 12 years, receiving multiple treatments including ECT and tricyclic antidepressants (TCA). The depression episodes recurred frequently from 1970 to 1975, and she experienced worsening symptoms in February 1978, including agitation, diaphoresis, and disorientation, leading to her hospitalization on February 21, 1978.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent unipolar depression since teens. Past treatments include multiple hospitalizations, ECT (100 treatments), and various medications including phenothiazines and lithium, which were discontinued due to side effects.
medical_history.family_history: Mother suffered from two clinical depressions.
